byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and AL BAKER

abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and Police Dept appear to have reached a quiet easing of strained relations, at least temporarily, after period of public hostility exacerbated by fatal shootings of two officers; moves toward reconciliation have been abetted by some union leaders, including Edward D Mullins of Sergeants Benevolent Assn, who privately met with de Blasio; mayor has made some subtle behind-the-scenes offers.
lead_paragraph: A secret meeting between Mayor Bill de Blasio and Edward D. Mullins of the Sergeants Benevolent Association, an outspoken critic, helped achieve détente.

headline.main: After Public Acrimony, Quieter Steps by Mayor de Blasio and Police to Mend Rift
headline.print_headline: Quiet Détente for de Blasio and the Police

snippet: A secret meeting between Mayor Bill de Blasio and Edward D. Mullins of the Sergeants Benevolent Association, an outspoken critic, helped achieve détente.
